summary:
These are the reasons why I can’t be trusted when going out shopping in the UK. 
Everywhere I look, there’s David, Billie, and...
body:
These are the reasons why I can’t be trusted when going out shopping in the UK.

Everywhere I look, there’s David, Billie, and basically everything I love.

(Got the books for 50p each, thank you charity shops. The old lady winked at me when I handed her the Belle de Jour, and she told me it stayed on that bookshelf for a while because no one dared to buy it, haha!)

Anyway. Don’t let me out on British streets, that’s all I have to say.

(BTW, I’ve done this before, if you don’t live in the UK and a mag/book/whatever comes out here and you want it, message me, I can mail it to you! :)

summary: Alright, so I have been diving back into Doctor Who because I just love the universe of it, and Jodie has me hopeful for another...
body:
Alright, so I have been diving back into Doctor Who because I just love the universe of it, and Jodie has me hopeful for another great era. But I will say this.

I think the Tenth Doctor will always be my favorite.

I have heard the debate about his treatment of Martha and while I sympathize with Martha, I really do, I don’t think it was out of character for Ten to be more distant with his next companion. He was going through grief.

Rose was his companion that brought him comfort after the Time War. Who made him care and see the wonders of the world again. Who promised him forever. She nearly died for him, and he did die for her. Nine’s regeneration into Ten was out of love for this human who gave him back his wanderlust. Who made him smile and even happy during the darkest days.

Then she was ripped from him and there was nothing he could do to see her again. He still wanted to protect his adopted home. For his sake and even for hers. He was basically adopted by the Tylers at this point, Jackie causing a fuss for him and Mickey even becoming good friends with him.


He basically lost the family he chose. Again. After losing everyone else in the Time War.

You wouldn’t want to put your heart (hearts) out again so easily after that. He put on a smile and ran from his emotions. Cause looking back hurt. He investigated, and stumbled upon this human who has a spark of potential. Like all his other companions.

“Oh Martha Jones, you’re a star”


I’m not sure if Martha even knew how much Rose meant to Ten. But I think the reminders and comparisons weren’t to belittle her. He cares for Martha. Enough to the point to be ashamed to see her become a soldier or “accidentally destroy half her life”

But the Doctor wanted to constantly remind himself to not get too attached. Cause that closeness can lead to heartbreak that doesn’t go away.

Martha also was the one who came along because she was attracted to the Doctor. I’m not sure if the Doctor really understood her flirting until way later on. And it did help her realize that she didn’t need anyone in the romantic sense to empower her. If she met someone, it’d be because she and her partner want to strive and improve each other.

Meanwhile, the Doctor is trying so hard, so very hard, to give her a good time. But he’s also processing his grief to someone who gave him so much after being alone from the Time War. Like her or not, Rose meant so much to the Doctor. I’d think for someone you lose that has that much impact on you, yeah, the grief can take awhile to go through.

The Family of Blood incident wasn’t really his fault either. The TARDIS chose the location and backstory for Ten as a human, but I do agree with his treatment of Martha beinghorrid in these two episodes.

But honestly, I don’t think he truly understood why she came with him until she explained why she was leaving. And he realized he wanted another companion who was strictly platonic. In comes Donna.

And I’m not saying Ten was faultless. He should’ve explained about why Rose meant so much to him. Cause I think Martha would understand that. Ten runs from emotions and anything that’s hard to look back on, because he thinks he destroys whatever he touches. Whenever he gives a part of his hearts away, it ends up ending in tragedy. Rose, Martha (when The Master came into power and he couldn’t do anything), Jenny, Donna, Sarah Jane, the list goes on.

He runs his mouth before he can process what he said as well. This has gotten him into a lot of jams as well. Midnight being an example

I guess why I connected with Ten so much was due to him being so complex. He wants to love Rose fully but he’s afraid to get hurt. He wants to help people but doesn’t really let people in to help him. He’s kinda punishing himself for being happy after he caused so much pain.

And if you still disagree with me, that’s alright! I just enjoy explaining why I love David Tennant and his characters. A lot of them have skeletons in the closet. And he’s marvelous at playing a broken cop, a shy detective, and an alien who loves too much, and I’m excited for these new audio books coming out soon. Have a great day! Allons-y!
